name: No Push-Up Burpees
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a standing position with your hands beside you on the ground.
2. Place your hands shoulder-width apart and bend your knees slightly to lower yourself into a squatting position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
3. From the squat position, swing both of your hands forward between your legs, placing them flat and together on the ground in front of your feet.
4. Next, push off from this low position with one hand on the ground and jump your feet backwards into a high plank position.
5. Immediately drop down to a no-push up burpee by lowering your body until your arms are bent at a 90-degree angle, but without pushing yourself away.
6. Instead of doing another push-up movement, from this low position quickly jump up off the ground and return to standing position.
7. Continue alternating legs on every second rep.
short_summary: The No Push-Up Burpees is a lower body exercise that involves rapid jumps between standing, squatting and plank positions, engaging various muscle groups in quick succession
